name: Volcanic Dwarves
background:
Volcanic Dwarves are Dwarves who have fully embraced magic and now harness the power of fire to defeat their foes. They reject the heavy armour of their kin, relying on their gods’ divine strength to allow them to continue fighting, and on the volcanic beasts that fight alongside them. 

The Volcanic Dwarves have abandoned the traditions and gods of their ancestors. These Dwarves did not return to their holds when the Orcs were defeated, as the scars of their humiliation ran too deep. Their thirst for revenge has led them south, to a new pantheon of Gods who have fostered their warlike ways.
backgroundFull:
The Dwarven tribes were once spread throughout Tyria, but as the plains were settled by humanity and Orcs and Giants came to the grasslands, the Dwarves retreated into the mountains. They made their homes in their mountains, creating powerful fortresses surrounded by terrace farms on the heights, and dug mines deep below. 

When Havoc arrived in Tyria, the Northern Dwarfholds were soon overrun. The northern Dwarves fought back even after losing their homes, and the southern Dwarves joined with the Great Alliance to protect their homes. With the Dwarven armies on campaign against Havoc, the Orcs attacked and soon conquered the Dwarfholds.

The remaining Dwarves had a difficult life under the Orcs. The Orcs drove the Dwarves out of their holds and took whatever they wished from their subjects. The Dwarves held little status, reduced to performing hard labour in the fields and mines, and with their former allies too weakened to help, they lived under cruel Orc rule for generations.

When the Rift opened, it damaged a number of Dwarfholds. Many Orcs were killed by cave-ins, others were forced to abandon the holds and leave behind much of their armour and weapons. The Dwarves took the opportunity to rise up, using whatever weapons and tools they could find to seize back their destroyed holds. While most Dwarves returned to their old homes, some no longer felt that they belonged there. These Dwarves felt the scars of their defeat particularly strongly and wanted revenge. They rampaged through the steppes, using whatever weapons they could take to pillage and destroy any Orc tribes they found. 

These Dwarves continued their rampage until they arrived at the Drake Mountains, a volcanic mountain range along the south of Tyria. They met a pantheon of warlike Volcanic Gods who encouraged them to embrace their rage. These Gods taught them to channel magic through runic tattoos, scars, and wounds on their bodies. 

Many Dwarves chose to follow them, adopting a sort of monastic lifestyle in the mountains, honing their fighting skills and learning to enter a battle-trance. They are eager to get revenge on the Orcs and anyone else who they believe insults their honour. They have little interest in industry or craftsmanship, instead they live simple lives, honouring their new Gods, and slaying any who would question their honour or skill. 

How will you avenge your people’s honour?

spells.name: Searing Heat
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Piercing Assault against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Lava Bolts
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 18", which takes 2 hits.

spells.name: Auric Fury
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Hit & Run Fighter once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Suffocating Ashes
spells.effect: Pick up to four enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits each.

spells.name: Seismic Shift
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get Grounded Protection once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Fire Storm
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 6", which take 3 hits with Pulverize each. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Grounded Protection Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Grounded Protection. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Stealth Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Stealth. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Drakesworn
specialRules.description: After this model is deployed, it may be placed anywhere fully within 9” of its position.

specialRules.name: Grounded Reinforcement Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Grounded Reinforcement. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Grounded Speed
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule has most of them within 1" of terrain when activated, they move +2" on Advance, and +4" on Rush/Charge during this activation.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Quick Shot. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Swift Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Swift. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Unstoppable in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Strider Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Strider. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Pulverize
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Piercing Assault against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Grounded Protection
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule has most of them within 1" of terrain, when they take wounds roll one die per wound, and on a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Grounded Reinforcement
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule has most of them within 1" of terrain, they get +1 to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Reinforcement
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule is shaken or fully destroyed, you may remove it from the table as destroyed and place a new copy of it fully within 12" of any table edge at the beginning of the next round after Ambushers have been deployed. Units that deploy via Reinforcement can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy, and this rule doesn’t apply to the new copy of the unit.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2” when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Swift
specialRules.description: This model may ignore the Slow rule.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Strider
specialRules.description: May ignore the effects of difficult terrain when moving, and only needs 2+ to pass jumping rolls.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after being in melee.
